actions.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure.

actions.committee: Committee on Environment and Public Works
actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

actions.in_committee: Committee on Environment and Public Works
actions.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Committee on Environment and Public Works. Reported to Senate by Senator Chafee without amendment. Without written report.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 377.
Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.
Received in the House.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.

actions.committee: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Public Buildings and Economic Development.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
actions.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
actions.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
actions.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
actions.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.
Reported by the Committee on Transportation. H. Rept. 105-619.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 224.
Mr. Kim moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Cleared for White House.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 105-232.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Public Buildings and Economic Development

official_title: A bill to designate the Federal building and United States courthouse located at 85 Marconi Boulevard in Columbus, Ohio, as the "Joseph P. Kinneary United States Courthouse".

summary.text: Designates the Federal building and U.S. courthouse located at 85 Marconi Boulevard in Columbus, Ohio, as the Joseph P. Kinneary United States Courthouse.

titles.title: A bill to designate the Federal building and United States courthouse located at 85 Marconi Boulevard in Columbus, Ohio, as the "Joseph P. Kinneary United States Courthouse".
